message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV. 

The paper deals with text classification, which is a common topic in natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. The use of pre-trained word embeddings and a human-in-the-loop approach also suggests a focus on NLP and potentially human-computer interaction (HCI). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The use of machine learning and the focus on accuracy suggests a possible fit with cs.LG (Machine Learning), while the use of distance measurements and the focus on document representations suggests a possible fit with cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The use of prototypes and the focus on classification suggest a possible fit with cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the use of embeddings and the potential application to web content suggest a possible fit with cs.CV (Computer Vision).
